name: The Inn at Kulaniapia Falls

reviews.text: This place is worth the drive.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem
It feels like you are staying at a good friend's beautiful waterfall estate for the weekend instead of a stuffy hotel.
reviews.text: I swam in the wonderful waterfall fed pond and took long walks along the winding road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is great, food wonderful, and room very clean and comfortable. It was the only
reviews.title: Here's the view you wanted!

reviews.text: place during my stay where I watched TV. I am not a huge fan of the TV, but it was nice to have.
reviews.title: A very private, beautiful find that I would return to in a minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is great place to stop when driving around the island. It was my stop between Volcano and North Kohala. The Botanical Garden is must see while in Hilo.
reviews.title: We loved our 3 nights at this relaxing country inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place, a little off the beaten path but well worth it for the beautiful waterfall, great rooms, and super breakfast. If you are in Hilo, this B & B is worth checking out.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay off the beaten path

reviews.text: Our first bed and breakfast experience. Really enjoyed the stay. Basic room, but didn't hang out in it. Wonderful breakfast by Heidi! Enjoyed the conversation. Very hands off, but accommodating. Beautiful property! Nice sleeping to the sound of the falls!!
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds and sounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed this B&B.... breakfast is prompt and wonderful; especially when the local lady sits with you to discuss the island with the guests!
reviews.title: Very relaxing location!
Secluded B&B Kulaniapia Falls
reviews.text: Breathtaking. Relaxing. Beautiful. The Inn at Kulaniapia Falls is truly awesome. Secluded, yet about 20 minutes from Hilo, this B&B is gorgeous. We hiked around the beautiful grounds and bamboo gardens, swam in the crystal clear water with its own waterfall, and enjoyed a wonderful island breakfast, with Kona coffee, of course! Truly amazing. Thanks to Len, his wife and staff. We absolutely loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am so glad I found this Inn! It was exactly right, everyone and everything was wonderful. We were staying with family on the Kona side in a resort. Resorts or nice, but they are not exactly our style. My husband and I wanted a night away, somewhere quieter and more natural. This was perfect! It's not exactly luxurious, but it is very nice and comfortable, and the setting is absolutely amazing! So beautiful and wild, it feels like you are in the middle of nowhere but it's actually only a couple of miles to town. An easy drive to come and go for dinner, etc. The website doesn't even do it justice, there's no way to show that the falls are RIGHT outside your room! Breakfast was plentiful and delicious, and Leah was wonderful company :) We stayed in the Maile Room in Harmony House, the room is pretty small but you won't care. It's probably the most private room in the Inn, upstairs and on the outside edge of the property. I'm recommending this Inn to everyone I know who is headed to the Big Island!
reviews.title: Cannot recommend it enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive into the Inn gives one a hint of the beautiful grounds at the end of the road. We arrived after dark so only got to appreciate the beauty of the grounds the next morning after our first great breakfast...which was topped by the BEST locally roasted coffee!
reviews.title: Incredible place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 2 different rooms in the Harmony House and both were lovely---one was slightly larger than the other but both were furnished in a very comfortable but elegant style.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After visiting many waterfalls during our monthlong vacation on several islands, I can only now really appreciate the waterfall at The Inn at Kulaniapia Falls; almost worth a stay in itself! Would definitely stay again if I return to Hilo.
reviews.title: What a View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Pagoda Guest House and loved it. We were right next to a beautiful waterfall and all you could hear was the rushing water. The place is very secluded, so if you like to get away from everything and be close to nature, this is for you. I would recommend buying a few groceries or getting dinner before coming in since the winding driveway is a little long. That way you can enjoy the trails to the waterfall and relax, which will not be difficult.
reviews.title: Best Place to stay near Hilo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in Hilo for a couple of nights and i found the Inn at Kulaniapia Falls. I thought i would give it a try. The room was nice and comfortable, the staff very friendly and the view of the waterfall was fantastic. We left our windows opened at night and went to sleep via the Gekos, crickets and the sound of the waterfall in the background. It was only 4 miles outside of Hilo the road is mostly single lane. It was not hard to find but would not try to find it at night.
reviews.title: Does anyone live here?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How many B&Bs come with their own waterfall? This place has 3 plus a bamboo garden and acres of macademia trees. It's secluded and quiet at night except for the birds doing interesting dialogue with each other. The beds were firm, there's free internet connection, and the breakfast was very nice with fresh fruit, breads, and most excellent coffee. Don't expect a lot of one on one with the owner but that's not a problem since clear directions are given to your assigned room in 1 of 3 houses on the grounds. It's about 15 minutes from downtown Hilo and the road is narrow and very dark at night.
reviews.title: Peaceful location and nice view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn has lovely rooms and outstanding staff. Breakfast was wonderful with lots of options. It's a beautiful drive from Hilo and isn't hard to find. Just follow their directions and the signs on the road. The falls are beautiful and it's quite relaxing to sit on the grounds or even in your room and listen to it. We would definitely recommend the Inn to friends!
reviews.title: Excellent facility!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed in this B&B. Felt more like a motel than a B&B. Hardly any welcoming at all....a binder (with broken rings and moldy corners) was in the main common room to "guide you". No welcoming binder in our room at all. Found out time for breakfast from other guests.
reviews.title: The waterfall was the only inspiring part to this B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very bland...and after a few days became quite boring. When I asked for a glass of milk I was told "we don't serve milk because it is too expensive"....at first I thought she was kidding me, but quickly realized she was not.
reviews.title: Stay here! Gorgeous location, beautiful rooms, great host.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I asked if I could use a phone I was told it had been out of service for a few days and they weren't sure when they would get service back.
reviews.title: A delightful find at the end of the road
